BITD.ability_character_a_little_somethin: a little something on the side
At the end of each downtime phase, you earn **+2 stash.**
Since this money comes at the end of downtime, after all downtime actions are resolved, you can’t remove it from your stash and spend it on extra activities until your **next** downtime phase.
BITD.ability_character_a_void_in_the_ech: You are invisible to spirits and may not be harmed by them. Take **2 stress** to cause living things to avert their gaze and fail to observe you for a few moments.
BITD.ability_character_alchemist_descrip: When you **invent** or **craft** a creation with *alchemical* features, take **+1 result level** to your roll. You begin with one special formula already known.
BITD.ability_character_alchemist_long_de: Follow the **Inventing** procedure with the GM (page 224) to define your first special alchemical formula.
BITD.ability_character_ambush_descriptio: When you attack from hiding or spring a trap, you get **+1d**.
BITD.ability_character_ambush_long_descr: This ability benefits from preparation— so don’t forget you can do that in a flashback.
BITD.ability_character_analyst_descripti: During **downtime**, you get **two ticks** to distribute among any long term project clocks that involve investigation or learning a new formula or design plan.
BITD.ability_character_analyst_long_desc: This ability benefits from preparation— so don’t forget you can do that in a flashback.
BITD.ability_character_arcane_sight_desc: Take **1 stress** to sense beyond human limits. "Hear" a subject's true thoughts or feelings, see in pitch darkness, sense the presence of invisible things, intuit the location of a hidden object, etc.
BITD.ability_character_artificer_descrip: When you **invent** or **craft** a creation with *spark-craft* features, take **+1 result level** to your roll. You begin with one special design already known.
BITD.ability_character_artificer_long_de: Follow the **Inventing** procedure with the GM (page 224) to define your first special spark-craft design.
BITD.ability_character_automaton_descrip: You are a spirit animating a clockwork body. You have human-like strength and senses, by default. Your hull has natural **armor** (this doesn't count for your **load**). Your former human feelings, interests, and connections are only dim memories. You now exist to fulfill your functions. Choose three. You may be rebuilt if damaged or destroyed. If your soul vessel is shattered, you are freed from servitude and become a Ghost. Whenever you would take stress, take **drain** instead.
BITD.ability_character_battleborn_descri: You may expend your **special armor** to reduce harm from an attack in combat or to **push yourself** during a fight.
BITD.ability_character_battleborn_long_d: When you use this ability, tick the special armor box on your playbook sheet. If you “reduce harm” that means the level of harm you’re facing right now is reduced by one. If you use this ability to push yourself, you get one of the benefits (+1d, +1 effect, act despite severe harm) but you don’t take 2 stress. Your special armor is restored at the beginning of downtime.
BITD.ability_character_bodyguard_descrip: When you **protect** a teammate, take +1d to your resistance roll. When you **gather info** to anticipate possible threats in the current situation, you get **+1 effect**.
BITD.ability_character_bodyguard_long_de: The **protect** teamwork maneuver lets you face a consequence for a teammate. If you choose to resist that consequence, this ability gives you +1d to your resistance roll. Also, when you read a situation to gather information about hidden dangers or potential attackers, you get +1 effect—which means more detailed information.
BITD.ability_character_calculating_descr: Due to your careful planning, during **downtime**, you may give yourself or another crew member +1 downtime action.
BITD.ability_character_calculating_long_: If you forget to use this ability during downtime, you can still activate it during the score and flashback to the previous downtime when the extra activity happened.
BITD.ability_character_cloak_and_dagger_: When you use a disguise or other form of covert misdirection, you get **+1d** to rolls to confuse or deflect suspicion. When you throw off your disguise, the resulting surprise gives you the initiative in the situation.

This ability gives you the chance to more easily get out of trouble if a covert operation goes haywire. Also, don’t forget your **fine disguise kit** item, which boosts the **effect** of your covert deception methods.
BITD.ability_character_compartments_desc: Your **items** are built-in to your frame and may recess beneath panels out of sight. Your frame can now carry +2 load.
BITD.ability_character_compel_descriptio: You can Attune to the ghost field to force a nearby ghost to appear and obey a command you give it. You are not supernaturally terrified by a ghost you summon or compel (though your allies may be).
BITD.ability_character_compel_long_descr: The GM will tell you if you sense any ghosts nearby. If you don’t, you can gather information (maybe **Attune**, **Survey**, or **Study**) to attempt to locate one. By default, a ghost wants to satisfy its need for life essence and to exact vengeance. When you compel it, you can give it a general or specific command, but the more general it is (like “Protect me”) the more the ghost will interpret it according to its own desires. Your control over the ghost lasts until the command is fulfilled, or until a day has passed, whichever comes first.
BITD.ability_character_connected_descrip: During downtime, you get **+1 result level** when you **acquire an asset** or **reduce heat**.
BITD.ability_character_connected_long_de: Your array of underworld connections can be leveraged to loan assets, pressure a vendor to give you a better deal, intimidate witnesses, etc.
BITD.ability_character_daredevil_descrip: When you roll a desperate action, you get **+1d** to your roll if you also take **-1d** to any resistance rolls against consequences from your action.
BITD.ability_character_daredevil_long_de: This special ability is a bit of a gamble. The bonus die helps you, but if you suffer consequences, they’ll probably be more costly to resist. But hey, you’re a daredevil, so no big deal, right?
BITD.ability_character_dark_talent_descr: Choose **Insight**, **Prowess**, or **Resolve**. Your max rating for actions under that attribute becomes 5. When you take this ability, add +1 dot to the resistance rating of the attribute you've chosen.
BITD.ability_character_dissipate_descrip: You can disperse the electroplasmic vapor of your ghostly form in order to pass through solid objects for a moment. Take 1 drain when you dissipate, plus 1 drain for each feature: *It lasts longer (a minute — an hour — a day) — you also become invisible — anything that passes through your form becomes dangerously electrified or frozen.*
BITD.ability_character_electroplasmic_pr: You may release some of your plasmic energy as an electrical shock around you or as a directed beam. You may also use this ability to create a lightning barrier to repel or trap a spirit. Take 1 drain for each level of **magnitude**.
BITD.ability_character_expertise_descrip: Choose one of your action ratings. When you lead a **group action** using that action, you can suffer only 1 stress at most regardless of the number of failed rolls.
BITD.ability_character_expertise_long_de: This special ability is good for covering for your team. If they’re all terrible at your favored action, you don’t have to worry about suffering a lot of stress when you lead their group action.
BITD.ability_character_focused_descripti: You may expend your **special armor** to resist a consequence of surprise or mental harm (fear, confusion, losing track of someone) or to **push yourself** for ranged combat or tracking.
BITD.ability_character_focused_long_desc: When you use this ability, tick the special armor box on your playbook sheet. If you “resist a consequence” of the appropriate type, you avoid it completely. If you use this ability to push yourself, you get one of the benefits (+1d, +1 effect, act despite severe harm) but you don’t take 2 stress. Your special armor is restored at the beginning of downtime.
BITD.ability_character_foresight_descrip: Two times per score you can **assist** a teammate without paying stress. Tell us how you prepared for this.
BITD.ability_character_foresight_long_de: You can narrate an event in the past that helps your teammate now, or you might explain how you expected this situation and planned a helpful contingency that you reveal now.
BITD.ability_character_fortitude_descrip: You may expend your **special armor** to resist a consequence of fatigue, weakness, or chemical effects, or to push yourself when working with technical skill or handling alchemicals.
BITD.ability_character_fortitude_long_de: When you use this ability, tick the special armor box on your playbook sheet. If you “resist a consequence” of the appropriate type, you avoid it completely. If you use this ability to push yourself, you get one of the benefits (+1d, +1 effect, act despite severe harm) but you don’t take 2 stress. Your special armor is restored at the beginning of downtime.
BITD.ability_character_frame_upgrade_des: Choose an additional frame feature. This upgrade may be taken up to four times.
BITD.ability_character_functioning_vice_: When you indulge your vice, you may adjust the dice outcome by 1 or 2 (up or down). An ally who joins in your vice may do the same.

If you indulged your vice and rolled a 4, you could increase the result to 5 or 6, or you could reduce the result to 3 or 2 (perhaps to avoid overindulgence). Allies that join you don’t need to have the same vice as you, just one that could be indulged alongside yours somehow.
BITD.ability_character_ghost_contract_de: When you shake on a deal, you and your partner — human or otherwise — both bear a mark of your oath. If either breaks the contract, they take level 3 harm, "Cursed".
BITD.ability_character_ghost_contract_lo: The mark of the oath is obvious to anyone who sees it (perhaps a magical rune appears on the skin). When you suffer “Cursed” harm, you’re incapacitated by withering: enfeebled muscles, hair falling out, bleeding from the eyes and ears, etc., until you either fulfill the deal or discover a way to heal the curse.
BITD.ability_character_ghost_fighter_des: You may imbue your hands, melee weapons, or tools with spirit energy. You gain **potency** in combat vs. the supernatural. You may grapple with spirits to restrain and capture them.
BITD.ability_character_ghost_fighter_lon: When you imbue yourself with spirit energy, how do you do it? What does it look like when the energy manifests? When you’re imbued, you can strongly interact with ghosts and spirit-stuff, rather than weakly interact.
BITD.ability_character_ghost_form_descri: You are now a concentration of electroplasmic vapor which resembles your living body and clothes. You may weakly interact with the physical world and vice versa. You're vulnerable to arcane powers and electroplasmic effects. You move about by floating and may fly swiftly without tiring. You may slowly flow through small openings as a vapor. You chill the area around you and are terrifying for the living to behold. You are affected by spiritbane charms (take 2 drain to overcome the repulsion). *Whenever you would take stress, take **drain** instead. When you would take trauma, take **gloom** instead.*
BITD.ability_character_ghost_hunter_desc: Your hunting pet is imbued with spirit energy. It gains **potency** when tracking or fighting the supernatural, and gains an arcane ability: *ghost-form*, *mind-link*, or *arrow-swift*. Take this ability again to choose an additional arcane ability for your pet.
BITD.ability_character_ghost_hunter_long: Your pet functions as a cohort (Expert: Hunter). This ability gives them potency against supernatural targets and an arcane ability of your choice. Ghost-form allows the pet to transform into electroplasmic vapor as if it were a spirit. Mindlink allows the pet and hunter to share their senses and thoughts telepathically. Arrow-swift allows the pet to move extremely quickly, out-pacing any other creature or vehicle.
BITD.ability_character_ghost_mind_descri: You're always aware of supernatural entities in your presence. Take +1d when you gather info about the supernatural.
BITD.ability_character_ghost_veil_descri: You may shift partially into the ghost field, becoming shadowy and insubstantial for a few moments. Take 2 stress when you shift, plus 1 stress for each extra feature: *It lasts for a few minutes rather than moments — you are invisible rather than shadowy — you may float through the air like a ghost*
BITD.ability_character_ghost_veil_long_d: This ability transforms you into an intangible shadow for a few moments. If you spend additional stress, you can extend the effect for additional benefits, which may improve your position or effect for action rolls, depending on the circumstances, as usual.
BITD.ability_character_ghost_voice_descr: You know the secret method to interact with a ghost or demon as if it was a normal human, regardless of how wild or feral it appears. You gain **potency** when communicating with the supernatural.
BITD.ability_character_ghost_voice_long_: The first part of this ability gives you permission to do something that is normally impossible: when you speak to a spirit, it always listens and understands you, even if it would otherwise be too bestial or insane to do so. The second part of the ability increases your effect when you use social actions with the supernatural.
BITD.ability_character_ghost_ward_descri: You know how to **Wreck** an area with arcane substances and methods so it is either anathema or enticing to spirits (your choice).
BITD.ability_character_ghost_ward_long_d: If you make an area anathema to spirits, they will do everything they can to avoid it, and will suffer torment if forced inside the area. If you make an area enticing to spirits, they will seek it out and linger in the area, and will suffer torment if forced to leave. This effect lasts for several days over an area the size of a small room. Particularly powerful or prepared spirits may roll their quality or arcane magnitude to see how well they’re able to resist the effect.
BITD.ability_character_infiltrator_descr: You are not affected by **quality** or **Tier** when you bypass security measures.
BITD.ability_character_infiltrator_long_: This ability lets you contend with higher-Tier enemies on equal footing. When you’re cracking a safe, picking a lock, or sneaking past elite guards, your effect level is never reduced due to superior Tier or quality level of your opposition. Are you a renowned safe cracker? Do people tell stories of how you slipped under the noses of two Chief Inspectors, or are your exceptional talents yet to be discovered?
BITD.ability_character_interface_descrip: You may **attune** to the local electroplasmic power field to control it or something connected to it (including another hull).
BITD.ability_character_iron_will_descrip: You're immune to the terror that some supernatural entities inflict on sight. Take +1d to resistance rolls with Resolve.
BITD.ability_character_iron_will_long_de: With this ability, you do not freeze up or flee when confronted by any kind of supernatural entity or strange occult event.
BITD.ability_character_jail_bird_descrip: When **incarcerated**, your wanted level counts as 1 less, your Tier as 1 more, and you gain +1 faction status with a faction you help on the inside (in addition to your incarceration roll).
BITD.ability_character_jail_bird_long_de: Zero is the minimum **wanted level**; this ability can’t make your **wanted level** negative. See the Incarceration roll, page 148.
BITD.ability_character_leader_descriptio: When you **Command** a **cohort** in combat, they continue to fight when they would otherwise **break** (they're not taken out when they suffer level 3 harm). They gain **+1 effect** and **1 armor**.
BITD.ability_character_leader_long_descr: This ability makes your cohorts more effective in battle and also allows them to resist harm by using armor. While you lead your cohorts, they won’t stop fighting until they take fatal harm (level 4) or you order them to cease. What do you do to inspire such bravery in battle?
BITD.ability_character_like_looking_into: You can always tell when someone is lying to you.
This ability works in all situations without restriction. It is very powerful, but also a bit of a curse. You see though every lie, even the kind ones.
BITD.ability_character_manifest_descript: Take 1 drain to flow through the electroplasmic pathways of the ghost field in order to instantly travel to any place you knew intimately in life, or to answer the summoning call of a **compel**.
BITD.ability_character_mastermind_descri: You may expend your **special armor** to protect a teammate, or to **push yourself** when you gather information or work on a long-term project.
BITD.ability_character_mastermind_long_d: When you use this ability, tick the special armor box on your playbook sheet. If you protect a teammate, this ability negates or reduces the severity of a consequence or harm that your teammate is facing. You don’t have to be present to use this ability—say how you prepared for this situation in the past. If you use this ability to push yourself, you get one of the benefits (+1d, +1 effect, act despite severe harm) but you don’t take 2 stress. Your special armor is restored at the beginning of downtime.
BITD.ability_character_mesmerism_descrip: When you **Sway** someone, you may cause them to forget that it's happened until they next interact with you.
BITD.ability_character_mesmerism_long_de: The victim’s memory “glosses over” the missing time, so it’s not suspicious that they’ve forgotten something. When you next interact with the victim, they remember everything clearly, including the strange effect of this ability.
BITD.ability_character_mule_description: Your load limits are higher. Light: 5. Normal: 7. Heavy: 8.
BITD.ability_character_mule_long_descrip: This ability is great if you want to wear heavy armor and pack a heavy weapon without attracting lots of attention. Since your exact gear is determined on-the-fly during an operation, having more load also gives you more options to get creative with when dealing with problems during a score.
BITD.ability_character_not_to_be_trifled: You can **push yourself** to do one of the following: *perform a feat of physical force that verges on the superhuman — engage a small gang on equal footing in close combat*.

When you push yourself to activate this ability, you still get one of the normal benefits of pushing yourself (+1d, +1 effect, etc.) in addition to the special ability. If you perform a feat that verges on the superhuman, you might break a metal weapon with your bare hands, tackle a galloping horse, lift a huge weight, etc. If you engage a small gang on equal footing, you don’t suffer reduced effect due to scale against a small gang (up to six people).
BITD.ability_character_occultist_descrip: You know the secret ways to Consort with ancient powers, forgotten gods or demons. Once you've consorted with one, you get +1d to command cultists who worship it.
BITD.ability_character_occultist_long_de: **Consorting** with a given entity may require special preparations or travel to a specific place. The GM will tell you about any requirements. You get the bonus die to your **Command** rolls because you can demonstrate a secret knowledge of or influence over the entity when you interact with cultists.
BITD.ability_character_overcharge_descri: Take **1 drain** to perform a feat of extreme strength or speed (run faster than a horse, rend metal with bare hands, etc.). *This factors into effect.*
BITD.ability_character_physicker_descrip: You can **Tinker** with bones, blood, and bodily humours to treat wounds or stabilize the dying. You may **study** a malady or corpse. Everyone in your crew gets **+1d** to their healing treatment rolls.
BITD.ability_character_physicker_long_de: Knowledge of anatomy and healing is a rare and esoteric thing in Duskwall. Without this ability, any attempts at treatment are likely to fail or make things worse. You can use this ability to give first aid (rolling **Tinker**) to allow your patient to ignore a harm penalty for an hour or two.
BITD.ability_character_poltergeist_descr: Take 1 drain to strongly interact with the physical world for a few moments (as if you had a normal body). Extend the reach and magnitude of your interaction to include telekinetic force and electroplasmic discharges by taking more drain (2-6).
BITD.ability_character_possess_descripti: You may **attune** to the ghost field in order to take control of a living body. When your control is challenged, you must re-attune (risking electroplasmic harm) or leave the body. Your control is challenged when: *you consume spirit energy from the host — when arcane powers act against you — when the host's will is driven to desperation*. You may easily and indefinitely possess a **hull** or **hollow** which has been ritually prepared for you (change your playbook to Hull or Vampire, respectively).
BITD.ability_character_reflexes_descript: When there's a question about who acts first, the answer is you (two characters with Reflexes act simultaneously).
BITD.ability_character_reflexes_long_des: This ability gives you the initiative in most situations. Some specially trained NPCs (and some demons and spirits) might also have reflexes, but otherwise, you’re always the first to act, and can interrupt anyone else who tries to beat you to the punch. This ability usually doesn’t negate the need to make an action roll that you would otherwise have to make, but it may improve your position or effect.
BITD.ability_character_ritual_descriptio: You can Study an occult ritual (or create a new one) to summon a supernatural effect or being. You know the arcane methods to perform ritual sorcery. You begin with one ritual already learned.
BITD.ability_character_ritual_long_descr: Without this special ability, the study and practice of rituals leaves you utterly vulnerable to the powers you supplicate. Such endeavors are not recommended. For more details, see Rituals, page 222.
BITD.ability_character_rooks_gambit_desc: Take **2 stress** to roll your best action rating while performing a different action. Say how you adapt your skill to this use.
BITD.ability_character_rooks_gambit_long: This is the “jack-of-all-trades” ability. If you want to attempt lots of different sorts of actions and still have a good dice pool to roll, this is the special ability for you.
BITD.ability_character_saboteur_descript: When you **Wreck**, the work is much quieter than it should be and the damage is hidden from casual inspection.
BITD.ability_character_saboteur_long_des: You can drill holes in things, melt stuff with acid, even use a muffled explosive, and it will all be very quiet and extremely hard to notice.
BITD.ability_character_savage_descriptio: When you unleash physical violence, it's especially frightening. When you **Command** a frightened target, take **+1d**.
BITD.ability_character_savage_long_descr: You instill fear in those around you when you get violent. How they react depends on the person. Some people will flee from you, some will be impressed, some will get violent in return. The GM judges the response of a given NPC. In addition, when you **Command** someone who’s affected by fear (from this ability or otherwise), take +1d to your roll.
BITD.ability_character_scout_description: When you **gather info** to locate a target, you get **+1 effect**. When you hide in a prepared position or use camouflage, you get **+1d** to rolls to avoid detection.
BITD.ability_character_scout_long_descri: A “target” can be a person, a destination, a good ambush spot, an item, etc.
BITD.ability_character_secondary_hull_de: Choose an additional frame and its starting feature. You may transfer your consciousness between your frames at will.
BITD.ability_character_shadow_descriptio: You may expend your **special armor** to resist a consequence from detection or security measures, or to **push yourself** for a feat of athletics or stealth.
BITD.ability_character_shadow_long_descr: When you use this ability, tick the special armor box on your playbook sheet. If you “resist a consequence” of the appropriate type, you avoid it completely. If you use this ability to push yourself, you get one of the benefits (+1d, +1 effect, act despite severe harm) but you don’t take 2 stress. Your special armor is restored at the beginning of downtime.
BITD.ability_character_sharpshooter_desc: You can **push yourself** to do one of the following: *make a ranged attack at extreme distance beyond what's normal for the weapon — unleash a barrage of rapid fire to suppress the enemy*.
BITD.ability_character_sharpshooter_long: When you push yourself to activate this ability, you still get one of the normal benefits of pushing yourself (+1d, +1 effect, etc.) in addition to the special ability. The first use of this ability allows you to attempt long-range sniper shots that would otherwise be impossible with the rudimentary firearms of Duskwall. The second use allows you to keep up a steady rate of fire in a battle (enough to “suppress” a small gang up to six people), rather than stopping for a slow reload or discarding a gun after each shot. When an enemy is suppressed, they’re reluctant to maneuver or attack (usually calling for a fortune roll to see if they can manage it).
BITD.ability_character_sinister_guile_de: During **downtime**, choose one: Get a free additional downtime activity, or take **+1d** to all downtime activity rolls.
BITD.ability_character_strange_methods_d: When you invent or craft a creation with arcane features, take +1 result level to your roll. You begin with one arcane design already known.
BITD.ability_character_strange_methods_l: Follow the **Inventing** procedure with the GM (page 224) to define your first arcane design.
BITD.ability_character_subterfuge_descri: You may expend your **special armor** to resist a consequence from suspicion or persuasion, or to **push yourself** for subterfuge.
BITD.ability_character_subterfuge_long_d: When you use this ability, tick the special armor box on your playbook sheet. If you “resist a consequence” of the appropriate type, you avoid it completely. If you use this ability to push yourself, you get one of the benefits (+1d, +1 effect, act despite severe harm) but you don’t take 2 stress. Your special armor is restored at the beginning of downtime.
BITD.ability_character_survivor_descript: From hard won experience or occult ritual, you are immune to the poisonous miasma of the deathlands and are able to subsist on the strange flora and fauna there. You get **+1 stress box**.
BITD.ability_character_survivor_long_des: This ability gives you an additional stress box, so you have 10 instead of 9. The maximum number of stress boxes a PC can have (from any number of additional special abilities or upgrades) is 12.
BITD.ability_character_tempest_descripti: You can push yourself to do one of the following: *unleash a stroke of lightning as a weapon — summon a storm in your immediate vicinity (torrential rain, roaring winds, heavy fog, chilling frost/snow, etc.).*
BITD.ability_character_tempest_long_desc: When you push yourself to activate this ability, you still get one of the normal benefits of pushing yourself (+1d, +1 effect, etc.) if you’re making a roll, in addition to the special ability. When you unleash lightning as a weapon, the GM will describe its effect level and significant collateral damage. If you unleash it in combat against an enemy who’s threatening you, you’ll still make an action roll in the fight (usually with **Attune**). When you summon a storm, the GM will describe its effect level. If you’re using this power as cover or distraction, it’s probably a **setup** teamwork maneuver, using **Attune**.
BITD.ability_character_terrible_power_de: Take 1 stress to perform a feat of superhuman strength or speed (run faster than a carriage, break stone with bare hands, leap onto the roof of a building, etc.). This factors into effect.
BITD.ability_character_the_devils_footst: When you **push yourself**, choose one of the following additional benefits: *perform a feat of athletics that verges on the superhuman—maneuver to confuse your enemies so they mistakenly attack each other*.

When you push yourself to activate this ability, you still get one of the normal benefits of pushing yourself (+1d, +1 effect, etc.) if you’re making a roll, in addition to the special ability. If you perform an athletic feat (running, tumbling, balance, climbing, etc.) that verges on the superhuman, you might climb a sheer surface that lacks good hand-holds, tumble safely out of a three-story fall, leap a shocking distance, etc. If you maneuver to confuse your enemies, they attack each other for a moment before they realize their mistake. The GM might make a fortune roll to see how badly they harm or interfere with each other.
BITD.ability_character_tough_as_nails_de: Penalties from harm are one level less severe (though level 4 harm is still fatal).
BITD.ability_character_trust_in_me_descr: You get **+1d** vs. a target with whom you have an intimate relationship.
BITD.ability_character_trust_in_me_long_: This ability isn’t just for social interactions. Any action can get the bonus. “Intimate” is for you and the group to define, it need not exclusively mean romantic intimacy.
BITD.ability_character_undead_descriptio: You are a spirit which animates an undead body. Your trauma is maxed out. Choose four trauma conditions which reflect your vampiric nature. Arcane attacks are potent against you. If you suffer fatal harm or trauma, your undead spirit is overwhelmed. You take level 3 harm: "Incapacitated" until you feed enough to recover. If you suffer arcane harm while in this state, you are destroyed utterly. Your XP tracks are longer (you now advance more slowly). You have more stress boxes.
BITD.ability_character_vengeful_descript: You gain an additional **xp trigger**: *You got payback against someone who harmed you or someone you care about*. If your crew helped you get payback, also mark crew xp.
BITD.ability_character_venomous_descript: Choose a drug or poison (from your bandolier stock) to which you have become immune. You can **push yourself** to secrete it through your skin or saliva or exhale it as a vapor.
BITD.ability_character_venomous_long_des: When you push yourself to activate this ability, you still get one of the normal benefits of pushing yourself (+1d, +1 effect, etc.) if you’re making a roll, in addition to the special ability. You choose the type of drug or poison when you get this ability. You may change the drug or poison by completing a long-term project. Only a single drug or poison may be chosen—you can’t become immune to any essences, oils, or other alchemical substances.
BITD.ability_character_vigorous_descript: You recover from harm faster. Permanently fill in one of your healing clock segments. Take **+1d** to healing treatment rolls.
BITD.ability_character_vigorous_long_des: Your healing clock becomes a 3-clock, and you get a bonus die when you recover.
BITD.ability_character_warded_descriptio: You may expend your special armor to resist a supernatural consequence, or to push yourself when you deal with arcane forces.
BITD.ability_character_warded_long_descr: When you use this ability, tick the special armor box on your playbook sheet. If you resist a consequence, this ability negates or reduces its severity. If you use this ability to push yourself, you get one of the benefits (+1d, +1 effect, act despite severe harm) but you don’t take 2 stress. Your special armor is restored at the beginning of downtime.
BITD.ability_character_weaving_the_web_d: You gain **+1d** to **Consort** when you **gather information** on a target for a score. You get **+1d** to the **engagement roll** for that operation.
BITD.ability_character_weaving_the_web_l: Your network of underworld connections can always be leveraged to gain insight for a job—even when your contacts aren’t aware that they’re helping you.
BITD.ability_crew_accord_description: Sometimes friends are as good as territory. You may count up to three **+3 faction statuses** you hold as if they are turf.
BITD.ability_crew_accord_long_descriptio: If your status changes, you lose the turf until it becomes +3 again. Regardless of how much turf you hold (from this ability or otherwise) the minimum rep cost to advance your Tier is always 6.
BITD.ability_crew_all_hands_description: During **downtime**, one of your cohorts may perform a downtime activity for the crew to **acquire an asset**, **reduce heat**, or work on a **long-term project.**
BITD.ability_crew_anointed_description: You get **+1d** to **resistance** rolls against supernatural threats. You get **+1d** to **healing** rolls when you have supernatural harm.
BITD.ability_crew_as_good_as_your_word_d: You may spend **rep** as **coin** in downtime actions. Vigilantes gain **Obligation** as a second vice.
BITD.ability_crew_avengers_description: Each PC may add +1 action rating to **Hunt**, **Prowl**, or **Command** (up to a max rating of 3).
BITD.ability_crew_blood_brothers_descrip: When you fight alongside your cohorts in combat, they get **+1d** for **teamwork** rolls (setup and group actions). All of your cohorts get the *thugs* type for free (if they're already thugs, add another type).
BITD.ability_crew_blood_brothers_long_de: If you have the Elite Thugs upgrade, it stacks with this ability. So, if you had an Adepts gang cohort, and the Elite Thugs upgrade, and then took Blood Brothers, your Adepts would add the Thugs type and also get +1d to rolls when they did Thug-type actions. This ability may result in a gang with three types, surpassing the normal limit of two.
BITD.ability_crew_bound_in_darkness_desc: You may use **teamwork** with any cult member, regardless of the distance separating you. By taking 1 stress, your whispered message is heard by every cultist.
BITD.ability_crew_bound_in_darkness_long: By what occult means does your teamwork manifest over distance? How is it strange or disturbing? By what ritualistic method are cult members initiated into this ability?
BITD.ability_crew_chosen_description: Each PC may add +1 action rating to **Attune**, **Study**, or **Sway** (up to a max rating of 3).
BITD.ability_crew_chosen_long_descriptio: Each player may choose the action they prefer (you don’t all have to choose the same one). If you take this ability during initial character and crew creation, it supersedes the normal starting limit for action ratings.
BITD.ability_crew_conviction_description: Each PC gains an additional **Vice**: *Worship*. When you indulge this vice and bring a pleasing sacrifice, you don't overindulge if you clear excess stress. In addition, your deity will **assist** any one action roll you make — from now until you indulge this vice again.
BITD.ability_crew_conviction_long_descri: What sort of sacrifice does your deity find pleasing?
BITD.ability_crew_crows_veil_description: Due to hard-won experience or occult ritual, your activities are hidden from the notice of the death-seeker crows. You don't take extra heat when killing is involved on a score.
BITD.ability_crew_crows_veil_long_descri: The bells don’t ring at the crematorium when a member of your crew kills someone. Do you have a “membership ritual” now that conveys this talent?
BITD.ability_crew_dangerous_description: Each PC may add +1 action rating to **Hunt**, **Skirmish**, or **Wreck** (up to a max rating of 3).
BITD.ability_crew_dangerous_long_descrip: Each player may choose the action they prefer (you don’t all have to choose the same one). If you take this ability during initial character and crew creation, it supersedes the normal starting limit for action ratings.
BITD.ability_crew_deadly_description: Each PC may add +1 action rating to **Hunt**, **Prowl**, or **Skirmish** (up to a max rating of 3).
BITD.ability_crew_deadly_long_descriptio: Each player may choose the action they prefer (you don’t all have to choose the same one). If you take this ability during initial character and crew creation, it supersedes the normal starting limit for action ratings.
BITD.ability_crew_door_kickers_descripti: When you execute an assault plan, take **+1d** to the **engagement** roll.
BITD.ability_crew_door_kickers_long_desc: This ability applies when the goal is to attack an enemy. It doesn’t apply to other operations you attempt that happen to involve fighting.
BITD.ability_crew_emberdeath_description: Due to hard-won experience or occult ritual, you know the arcane method to destroy a living victim's spirit at the moment you kill them. Take 3 stress to channel electroplasmic energy from the ghost field to disintegrate the spirit and dead body in a shower of sparking embers.
BITD.ability_crew_emberdeath_long_descri: This ability activates at the moment of the target’s death (spend 3 stress then or lose the opportunity to use it). It can only be triggered by a killing blow. Some particularly powerful supernatural entities or specially protected targets may be resistant or immune to this ability.
BITD.ability_crew_everyone_steals_descri: Each PC may add +1 action rating to **Prowl**, **Finesse**, or **Tinker** (up to a max rating of 3).
BITD.ability_crew_everyone_steals_long_d: Each player may choose the action they prefer (you don’t all have to choose the same one). If you take this ability during initial character and crew creation, it supersedes the normal starting limit for action ratings.
BITD.ability_crew_favors_description: Spend one **rep** and describe how one of your contacts is put out to help you. Everyone in your crew gets one dot in an action your contact is skilled in for this score.
BITD.ability_crew_fiends_description: Fear is as good as respect. You may count each **wanted level** as if it was **turf**.
BITD.ability_crew_fiends_long_descriptio: The maximum **wanted level** is 4. Regardless of how much turf you hold (from this ability or otherwise) the minimum **rep** cost to advance your Tier is always 6.
BITD.ability_crew_forged_in_the_fire_des: Each PC has been toughened by cruel experience. You get **+1d** to **resistance** rolls.
BITD.ability_crew_forged_in_the_fire_lon: This ability applies to PCs in the crew. It doesn’t confer any special toughness to your cohorts.
BITD.ability_crew_ghost_echoes_descripti: From weird experience or occult ritual, all crew members gain the ability to see and interact with the ghostly structures, streets, and objects within the echo of Doskvol that exists in the ghost field.
BITD.ability_crew_ghost_echoes_long_desc: You might explore the echo of an ancient building, crumbled to dust in the real world, but still present in the ghost field; or discern the electroplasmic glow of treasures lost in the depths of the canals; or use a sorcerous ghost door from the pre-cataclysm to infiltrate an otherwise secure location; etc. The GM will tell you what echoes persist nearby when you gather information about them. You might also undertake investigations to discover particular echoes you hope to find.
BITD.ability_crew_ghost_market_descripti: Through arcane ritual or hard-won experience, you have discovered how to prepare your product for sale to ghosts and/or demons. *They do not pay in coin. What do they pay with?*
BITD.ability_crew_ghost_market_long_desc: The GM will certainly have an idea about how your strange new clients pay, but jump in with your own ideas, too! This ability is usually a big shift in the game, so talk it out and come up with something that everyone is excited about. If it’s a bit mysterious and uncertain, that’s good. You have more to explore that way.
BITD.ability_crew_ghost_passage_descript: From harsh experience or occult ritual, all crew members become immune to possession by spirits, but may choose to "carry" a second ghost as a passenger within their body.
BITD.ability_crew_ghost_passage_long_des: What do you do to “carry” a spirit? Must the spirit consent, or can you use this ability to trap an unwilling spirit within?
BITD.ability_crew_glory_incarnate_descri: Your deity sometimes manifests in the physical world. This can be a great boon, but the priorities and values of a god are not those of mortals. You have been warned.
BITD.ability_crew_high_society_descripti: It's all about who you know. Take **-1 heat** during downtime and **+1d** to **gather info** about the city's elite.
BITD.ability_crew_hooked_description: Your gang members use your product. Add the *savage*, *unreliable*, or *wild* flaw to your gangs to give them **+1 quality**.
BITD.ability_crew_just_passing_through_d: During **downtime**, take -1 heat. When your heat is 4 or less, you get **+1d** to deceive people when you pass yourselves off as ordinary citizens.
BITD.ability_crew_leverage_description: Your crew supplies contraband for other factions. Your success is good for them. Whenever you gain rep, gain **+1 rep**.
BITD.ability_crew_like_part_of_the_famil: Create one of your vehicles as a **cohort** (use the vehicle edges and flaws, below). Its **quality** is equal to your Tier +1.
BITD.ability_crew_misdirection_descripti: At the end of a score, you may sacrifice half the **rep** gained to make another faction lose status with your target instead of your crew. How do you pin it on someone else?
BITD.ability_crew_moral_compass_descript: Each PC gains an additional **xp trigger**: You fulfilled an obligation at a cost to you or the crew.
BITD.ability_crew_no_traces_description: When you keep an operation quiet or make it look like an accident, you get half the rep value of the target (round up) instead of zero. When you end **downtime** with zero heat, take **+1 rep**.
BITD.ability_crew_no_traces_long_descrip: There are many clients who value quiet operations. This ability rewards you for keeping a low-profile.
BITD.ability_crew_pack_rats_description: Your lair is a jumble of stolen items. When you roll to **acquire an asset**, take *+1d*.
BITD.ability_crew_pack_rats_long_descrip: This ability might mean that you actually have the item you need in your pile of stuff, or it could mean you have extra odds and ends to barter with.
BITD.ability_crew_patron_description: When you advance your **Tier**, it costs **half the coin** it normally would. *Who is your patron? Why do they help you?*
BITD.ability_crew_patron_long_descriptio: Who is your patron? Why do they help you?
BITD.ability_crew_predators_description: When you use stealth or subterfuge to commit murder, take **+1d** to the **engagement** roll.
BITD.ability_crew_predators_long_descrip: This ability applies when the goal is murder. It doesn’t apply to other stealth or deception operations you attempt that happen to involve killing.
BITD.ability_crew_reavers_description: When you go into conflict aboard a vehicle, you gain **+1 effect** for vehicle damage and speed. Your vehicle gains **armor**.
BITD.ability_crew_reavers_long_descripti: If your vehicle already has armor, this ability gives an additional armor box.
BITD.ability_crew_renegades_description: Each PC may add +1 action rating to **Finesse**, **Prowl**, or **Skirmish** (up to a max rating of 3).
BITD.ability_crew_renegades_long_descrip: Each player may choose the action they prefer (you don’t all have to choose the same one). If you take this ability during initial character and crew creation, it supersedes the normal starting limit for action ratings.
BITD.ability_crew_roots_description: During downtime one of your contacts or cohorts may take a downtime action to acquire an asset, reduce heat, or recover.
BITD.ability_crew_sealed_in_blood_descri: Each human sacrifice yields -3 stress cost for any ritual you perform.
BITD.ability_crew_sealed_in_blood_long_d: For details on Rituals, see page 222.
BITD.ability_crew_second_story_descripti: When you execute a clandestine infiltration, you get *+1d* to the **engagement roll**.
BITD.ability_crew_silver_tongues_descrip: Each PC may add +1 action rating to **Command**, **Consort**, or **Sway** (up to a max rating of 3).
BITD.ability_crew_silver_tongues_long_de: Each player may choose the action they prefer (you don’t all have to choose the same one). If you take this ability during initial character and crew creation, it supersedes the normal starting limit for action ratings
BITD.ability_crew_slippery_description: When you roll **entanglements**, roll twice and keep the one you want. When you **reduce heat** on the crew, take **+1d**.
BITD.ability_crew_slippery_long_descript: The GM might sometimes want to choose an entanglement instead of rolling. In that case, they’ll choose two and you can pick between them.
BITD.ability_crew_synchronized_descripti: When you perform a **group action**, you may count multiple 6s from different rolls as a critical success.
BITD.ability_crew_synchronized_long_desc: For example, Lyric leads a group action to Attune to the ghost field to overcome a magical ward on the Dimmer Sisters’ door. Emily, Lyric’s player, rolls and gets a 6, and so does Matt! Because the crew has Synchronized, their two separate 6s count as a critical success on the roll.
BITD.ability_crew_the_good_stuff_descrip: Your merchandise is exquisite. The product quality is equal to your **Tier+2**. When you deal with a crew or faction, the GM will tell you who among them is hooked on your product (one, a few, many, or all).
BITD.ability_crew_the_good_stuff_long_de: The quality of your product might be used for a fortune roll to find out how impressed a potential client is, to find out how enthralled or incapacitated a user is in their indulgence of it, to discover if a strange variation has side-effects, etc.
BITD.ability_crew_thorn_in_your_side_des: When you use Stealth or Assault plans against a higher **Tier** faction, your **Tier** counts as +1.
BITD.ability_crew_uncanny_preparation_de: Twice per session during a Desperate action, improve your effect or position. Describe a flashback that gives you the advantage now (setup action).
BITD.ability_crew_veteran_description: Choose a special ability from another crew (can be taken more than once).
BITD.ability_crew_vipers_description: When you acquire or craft poisons, you get +1 result level to your roll. When you employ a poison, you are specially prepared to be immune to its effects.
BITD.ability_crew_vipers_long_descriptio: The poison immunity lasts for the entire score, until you next have downtime.
BITD.ability_crew_war_dogs_description: When you're at war (-3 faction status), your crew does not suffer -1 hold and PCs still get two downtime activities, instead of just one.
BITD.ability_crew_zealotry_description: Your cohorts have abandoned their reason to devote themselves to the cult. They will undertake any service, no matter how dangerous or strange. They gain **+1d** to rolls against enemies of the faith.
BITD.background_academic_description: A scholar, a professor or student from Doskvol Academy, a philosopher or journalist, etc.
BITD.background_labor_description: A servant, a factory worker, a coach driver, a docker, a sailor, a Rail Jack, etc. *A stevedore for the North Hook Company*.
BITD.background_law_description: An advocate or barrister, a Bluecoat or inspector (or even Spirit Warden), a prison guard from Ironhook, etc.
BITD.background_military_description: A shopkeeper, a merchant, a skilled crafts-person, a shipping agent, etc. *A liaison to the Ministry of Preservation*.
BITD.background_noble_description: An Imperial or Skovlander soldier, a mercenary, an intelligence operative, a strategist, a training instructor, etc.
BITD.background_trade_description: A dilettante, a courtier, the scion of a fallen house, etc.
BITD.background_underworld_description: A street urchin, gang member, young thug, or other outcast who grew up on the streets.
BITD.claim_ancient_altar_description: You get **+1d** to the **engagement roll** for occult plans.
BITD.claim_ancient_gate_long_description: When you leave the city through this gate, spirits in the deathlands will not molest you unless directly provoked.
BITD.claim_ancient_obelisk_description: -1 stress cost for all arcane powers and rituals.
BITD.claim_ancient_obelisk_long_descript: This effect applies to all cultists, everywhere - so long as the deity is well-pleased. You don't have to be on-site at the obelisk to benefit from its power.
BITD.claim_ancient_tower_description: You get **+1d** to **Consort** with arcane entities on-site.
BITD.claim_ancient_tower_long_descriptio: This tower was prepared by sorcery from the pre-cataclysm and acts as an arcane lens to focus eldritch energy across the black mirror into the void.
BITD.claim_barracks_long_description: Extra room means more gang members.
BITD.claim_bluecoat_confederates_descrip: You get **+1d** to the **engagement roll** for assault plans.
BITD.claim_bluecoat_confederates_long_de: The street patrol around here helps you out now.
BITD.claim_bluecoat_intimidation_long_de: The law doesn't want any trouble from you; they look the other way.
BITD.claim_city_records_description: You get **+1d** to the **engagement roll** for **stealth** plans.
BITD.claim_city_records_long_description: You can use blueprints and other documents to determine a good approach for infiltrations.
BITD.claim_cloister_long_description: More room for hopeful novices desperate to pledge their service.
BITD.claim_cover_identities_description: You get **+1d** to the **engagement roll** for deception and social plans.
BITD.claim_cover_identities_long_descrip: False identities help confuse the opposition.
BITD.claim_cover_operation_long_descript: What's your cover? Who did you seize it from?
BITD.claim_covert_drop_description: You get **+2 coin** in **payoff** for scores that involve espionage or sabotage.
BITD.claim_covert_drop_long_description: The perfect hidden exchange point is worth the extra **coin** to discerning clientele.
BITD.claim_drug_den_description: Any time during downtime, roll dice equal to your Tier. You earn **coin** equal to the highest result, minus your **heat**.
BITD.claim_envoy_description: You get **+2 coin** in **payoff** for scores that involve high-class clients.
BITD.claim_envoy_long_description: This well-connected liaison will help arrange for a better **payoff** from rich clients.
BITD.claim_fighting_pits_description: During downtime, roll dice equal to your Tier. You earn **coin** equal to the highest result, minus your **heat**.
BITD.claim_fighting_pits_long_descriptio: The locals love to gamble away their hard-won **coin** on the bloodsports you host.
BITD.claim_fixer_description: You get **+2 coin** in **payoff** for scores that involve lower-class clients.
BITD.claim_fixer_long_description: This well-respected agent will help arrange for a better **payoff** from poorer clients.
BITD.claim_fleet_description: Your cohorts have their own vehicles.
BITD.claim_fleet_long_description: Each cohort has a common vehicle, with quality equal to your Tier.
BITD.claim_foreign_market_description: Any time during downtime, roll dice equal to your Tier. You earn **coin** equal to the highest result, minus your **heat**.
BITD.claim_foreign_market_long_descripti: Some of your product makes its way out of the city.
BITD.claim_gambling_den_description: Any time during downtime, roll dice equal to your Tier. You earn **coin** equal to the highest result, minus your **heat**.
BITD.claim_gambling_den_long_description: Cards, dice, or something more unusual on offer?
BITD.claim_hagfish_farm_description: When you use the reduce **heat** downtime activity after a score that involves killing, you get **+1d** to the roll and quiet, convenient disposal of any corpses you left on the job.
BITD.claim_infirmary_description: You get **+1d** to healing treatment rolls.
BITD.claim_infirmary_long_description: The infirmary also has beds for long-term convalescence.
BITD.claim_informants_description: You get **+1d** to gather information for a score.
BITD.claim_informants_long_description: Your eyes and ears on the streets are always on the lookout for new clients.
BITD.claim_local_graft_description: You get **+2 coin** in **payoff** for scores that involve a show of force or socializing.
BITD.claim_local_graft_long_description: A few city officials share bribe money with those who show that they're players on the scene.
BITD.claim_lookouts_description: You get **+1d** to **Hunt** or **Survey** on your turf.
BITD.claim_loyal_fence_description: You get **+2 coin** in **payoff** for scores that involve burglary or robbery.
BITD.claim_loyal_fence_long_description: It requires a skilled eye and good contacts to move stolen goods.
BITD.claim_luxury_fence_description: You get **+2 coin** in **payoff** for scores that involve highclass targets.
BITD.claim_luxury_fence_long_description: It requires a skilled eye and good contacts to move hot luxury goods.
BITD.claim_luxury_venue_long_description: Silks, paintings, and crystal impress the clientele.
BITD.claim_offertory_description: You get **+2 coin** in your **payoff** for scores that involve occult operations.
BITD.claim_offertory_long_description: The frightened locals offer you tribute when you perform your dark practices. They don't want to be next.
BITD.claim_personal_clothier_description: You get **+1d** to the **engagement roll** for social plans.
BITD.claim_personal_clothier_long_descri: You always arrive on the scene in the most current and alluring fashion.
BITD.claim_protection_racket_description: Any time during downtime, roll dice equal to your Tier. You earn **coin** equal to the highest result, minus your **heat**.
BITD.claim_protection_racket_long_descri: Some of the locals are terrified of you and will gladly pay for "protection."
BITD.claim_sacred_nexus_description: You get **+1d** to healing treatment rolls.
BITD.claim_sacred_nexus_long_description: Ancient arcane energy seeps into the wounded here, speeding their recovery, and marking them consecrated by its power.
BITD.claim_sanctuary_long_description: Your sanctuary maintains its effect as long as your deity is well-pleased with your service.
BITD.claim_secret_pathways_description: You get **+1d** to the **engagement roll** for stealth plans.
BITD.claim_secret_pathways_long_descript: You might have access to long-forgotten underground canals, rooftop walkways, or some other route of your choosing.
BITD.claim_secret_routes_description: You get **+1d** to the **engagement roll** for transport plans.
BITD.claim_secret_routes_long_descriptio: You might have access to longforgotten underground canals, dark streets normally hidden behind debris, or some other route of your choosing.
BITD.claim_side_business_description: Any time during downtime, roll dice equal to your Tier. You earn **coin** equal to the highest result, minus your **heat**.
BITD.claim_side_business_long_descriptio: What kind of legitimate business is this? How do you get paid in secret?
BITD.claim_spirit_well_long_description: A spirit well draws ghosts and other things to its power, which you harness to aid your arts.
BITD.claim_street_fence_description: You get **+2 coin** in your **payoff** for scores that involve lower-class targets.
BITD.claim_street_fence_long_description: An expert can find the treasure amid the trash you loot from your poorer victims.
BITD.claim_surplus_caches_description: You get **+2 coin** in **payoff** for scores that involve product sale or supply.
BITD.claim_surplus_caches_long_descripti: You have an abundance of product, which pads your pockets every now and then.
BITD.claim_tavern_description: You get **+1d** to **Consort** and **Sway** rolls on-site.
BITD.claim_tavern_long_description: Some booze and friendly conversation can go a long way.
BITD.claim_terrorized_citizens_descripti: You get **+2 coin** in your **payoff** for scores that involve battle or extortion.
BITD.claim_terrorized_citizens_long_desc: The frightened locals offer you tribute whenever you lash out. They don't want to be next.
BITD.claim_training_rooms_long_descripti: Extra training enables them to fight like a larger gang.
BITD.claim_vice_den_description: Any time during downtime, roll dice equal to your Tier. You earn **coin** equal to the highest result, minus your **heat**.
BITD.claim_vice_den_long_description: Perhaps you sell some of the contraband you smuggle here? Or do you not mix your operations?
BITD.claim_victim_trophies_long_descript: Word of your grisly "collection" gets around, and your boldness boosts your rep in the underworld.
BITD.claim_warehouse_description: You get **+1d** to acquire asset rolls.
BITD.claim_warehouse_long_description: You have space to hold all the various items and supplies you end up with from your smuggling runs. They can be useful on their own or for barter when you need it.
BITD.claim_warehouses_description: You get **+1d** to acquire asset rolls.
BITD.claim_warehouses_long_description: You have space to hold all the various spoils you end up with after your battles. It can be useful on its own or for barter when you need it.
BITD.contacts_adelaide_phroaig_long_desc: Perhaps a source for scores among the elite?
BITD.contacts_adikin_long_description: Perhaps a medium to the dark powers?
BITD.contacts_amancio_long_description: Perhaps a well-connected underworld figure, famous for their neutrality?
BITD.contacts_augus_long_description: Perhaps a good source for building schematics and historical details, or perhaps a rival who designs a security measures?
BITD.contacts_bazso_baz_long_description: Perhaps a paramour pursuing your affections, or perhaps a former lover, now scorned?
BITD.contacts_bennett_long_description: Perhaps he's seen them in the stars, or the sea?
BITD.contacts_bryl_long_description: Perhaps a reliable underworld contact, or perhaps an old partner with a grudge?
BITD.contacts_casta_long_description: Perhaps a mentor who trained you in the deadly arts, or vice versa?
BITD.contacts_celene_long_description: Celene is a guardian; a protector. Who does she watch over?
BITD.contacts_chael_long_description: Perhaps a member of a gang that you were in before the current crew, or an independent operator who's been in your way before?
BITD.contacts_conway_long_description: Perhaps an informant within the City Watch?
BITD.contacts_darmot_long_description: Perhaps a savvy officer that's busted you many times, or perhaps an old friend who turned to the law instead of crime?
BITD.contacts_decker_long_description: Perhaps a client in need of the illegal tools of the revolution?
BITD.contacts_dowler_long_description: Perhaps one of the rare deathlands scavengers that survived his sentence?
BITD.contacts_eckerd_long_description: Perhaps a good source of "raw materials"?
BITD.contacts_elynn_long_description: Perhaps a friend who can help with the infernal paperwork of the Empire?
BITD.contacts_esme_long_description: Perhaps a good source of news and gossip?
BITD.contacts_exeter_long_description: Perhaps a double-agent informant for you?
BITD.contacts_fitz_long_description: Perhaps an afficionado of strange artifacts?
BITD.contacts_flint_long_description: Perhaps a good source for unusual arcane supplies, or perhaps a rival in the occult world of Duskwall?
BITD.contacts_frake_long_description: Perhaps an expert that you go to for consultations, or perhaps a master who creates locks to defeat you?
BITD.contacts_gagan_long_description: Perhaps a scholar reluctantly answering the dark calling?
BITD.contacts_grace_long_description: Perhaps a former partner in thuggery, or a competitor on the scene?
BITD.contacts_harker_long_description: Perhaps a friend who you helped when you were in prison, or perhaps an enemy who hurt you when you served your time?
BITD.contacts_hoxley_long_description: Perhaps a friend of powerful ship captains?
BITD.contacts_irimina_long_description: Perhaps a potential patron for your crew?
BITD.contacts_jennah_long_description: Perhaps a good source for gossip among the upper class?
BITD.contacts_jeren_long_description: Perhaps a double-agent within the City Watch, or perhaps an overly curious officer, interested in your crimes?
BITD.contacts_jul_long_description: What other strange clients do they have?
BITD.contacts_karlos_long_description: Perhaps a source for off-book government "wet work"
BITD.contacts_klyra_long_description: Perhaps a good source for gossip?
BITD.contacts_laroze_long_description: Perhaps an informant within the City Watch?
BITD.contacts_lutes_long_description: Perhaps a good source of news and gossip?
BITD.contacts_lydra_long_description: Perhaps known for her vicious retribution on those who don't hold up to their end?
BITD.contacts_malista_long_description: To what forgotten god does Malista give her service?
BITD.contacts_marlane_long_description: Perhaps a pit fighter down at the docks, or a boxing coach who trained you?
BITD.contacts_marlo_long_description: Perhaps a good partner with a gang of tough thugs?
BITD.contacts_mateas_kline_long_descript: Perhaps he seeks to bring his family into the fold?
BITD.contacts_meg_long_description: Perhaps a trainer, or perhaps a fellow extortion artist?
BITD.contacts_melvir_long_description: Perhaps an old friend who's patched you up many times, or someone to whom you've sent too many victims?
BITD.contacts_mercy_long_description: Perhaps an assassin for hire, or a particularly deadly underworld scoundrel?
BITD.contacts_moriya_long_description: Perhaps she collects spirits for sacrifice?
BITD.contacts_nyelle_long_description: Perhaps a supplier for the strangest of cargo?
BITD.contacts_nyryx_long_description: Perhaps an informant to spark potential marks, or perhaps a rival manipulator?
BITD.contacts_petra_long_description: Perhaps a good source of information?
BITD.contacts_quellyn_long_description: Perhaps a knowledgeable healer and seer, or perhaps a student of yours who left over bad blood?
BITD.contacts_rigney_long_description: Perhaps a good source of news and gossip?
BITD.contacts_riven_long_description: Perhaps a good source of medicines for recovery?
BITD.contacts_rolan_long_description: Perhaps a client with strong underworld ties?
BITD.contacts_rolan_wott_long_descriptio: Perhaps with a feckless son in Doskvol academy, always in need of rescuing?
BITD.contacts_roslyn_kellis_long_descrip: Perhaps an old friend and confidant, or perhaps one of the victims of your espionage, bent on revenge?
BITD.contacts_salia_long_description: Perhaps a reliable contact for underworld jobs, or perhaps a former partner who sold you out?
BITD.contacts_sawtooth_long_description: Perhaps a buddy from the war, or perhaps a butcher who botched your treatment?
BITD.contacts_scurlock_long_description: Perhaps a mentor, or perhaps a deadly rival?
BITD.contacts_sera_long_description: Perhaps a supplier with military access?
BITD.contacts_setarra_description: Perhaps your partner in a dark endeavour, or perhaps an entity you once controlled, seeking vengeance?
BITD.contacts_sevoy_long_description: Perhaps a connection to clients with deep pockets?
BITD.contacts_stazia_long_description: Perhaps a former scoundrel turned to legitimate alchemical business, or perhaps the other way around?
BITD.contacts_steiner_long_description: Perhaps one of your competitors, or a former partner before you joined the crew?
BITD.contacts_telda_long_description: Perhaps a mentor who taught you your skills, or perhaps a rival sneak-thief?
BITD.contacts_tomas_long_description: Perhaps a former thug turned doctor?
BITD.contacts_trev_long_description: Perhaps a gang that helped your crew get started?
BITD.contacts_veldren_long_description: Perhaps an addict to poisoned to ever return to lucid thought, or perhaps an explorer of psychedelic realms beyond mere mortal experience?
BITD.contacts_veleris_long_description: Who does Veleris give his information to?
BITD.contacts_walker_long_description: Perhaps an employer who often needs violent work?
BITD.crew_upgrade_assassins_rigging_desc: You get 2 free load worth of weapon or gear items.
BITD.crew_upgrade_assassins_rigging_long: For example, you could carry a pistol (a weapon) and burglary tools (gear) for zero load.
BITD.crew_upgrade_barge_description: Add *mobility* to your lair. You can move it to a new location as a downtime activity.
BITD.crew_upgrade_bravos_rigging_descrip: You get 2 free load worth of weapon or armor items.
BITD.crew_upgrade_bravos_rigging_long_de: For example, you could carry a sword & pistol or wear normal armor for zero load.
BITD.crew_upgrade_camouflage_description: Your vehicles are perfectly concealed when at rest. They blend in as part of the environment, or as an uninteresting civilian vehicle (your choice).
BITD.crew_upgrade_composed_description: Each PC gets +1 stress box. This costs three upgrades to unlock, not just one.
BITD.crew_upgrade_cult_rigging_descripti: You get 2 free load worth of document or implement items.
BITD.crew_upgrade_cult_rigging_long_desc: For example, you could carry a profane book of curses and a demon’s hand for zero load.
BITD.crew_upgrade_elite_adepts_descripti: All of your cohorts with the Adepts type get **+1d** to quality rolls for Adept-related actions.
BITD.crew_upgrade_elite_rooks_descriptio: All of your cohorts with the Rooks type get **+1d** to quality rolls for Rook-related actions.
BITD.crew_upgrade_elite_rovers_descripti: All of your cohorts with the Rovers type get **+1d** to quality rolls for Rover-related actions.
BITD.crew_upgrade_elite_skulks_descripti: All of your cohorts with the Skulks type get **+1d** to quality rolls for Skulk-related actions.
BITD.crew_upgrade_elite_thugs_descriptio: All of your cohorts with the Thugs type get **+1d** to quality rolls for Thug-related actions.
BITD.crew_upgrade_hardened_description: Each PC gets **+1 trauma** box. This costs three upgrades to unlock, not just one.
BITD.crew_upgrade_hardened_long_descript: This may bring a PC with 4 **trauma** back into play if you wish.
BITD.crew_upgrade_hawkers_rigging_descri: One carried item is concealed and has no load.
BITD.crew_upgrade_hawkers_rigging_long_d: For example, you could carry a load of drugs or a weapon, perfectly concealed, for zero load.
BITD.crew_upgrade_ironhook_contacts_desc: Your Tier is effectively +1 higher in prison.
BITD.crew_upgrade_ironhook_contacts_long: This counts for any Tier-related element in prison, including the incarceration roll (see page 148).
BITD.crew_upgrade_ordained_description: Each PC gets **+1 trauma box**. This costs three upgrades to unlock, not just one.
BITD.crew_upgrade_ordained_long_descript: This may bring a PC with 4 **trauma** back into play if you wish.
BITD.crew_upgrade_ritual_sanctum_in_lair: This counts as a sacred and arcane **workshop** for occult practices and rituals.
BITD.crew_upgrade_smugglers_rigging_desc: Two of your carried items are perfectly concealed.
BITD.crew_upgrade_smugglers_rigging_long: You could carry 1 load of contraband and a pistol, perfectly concealed, even against a pat down.
BITD.crew_upgrade_steady_description: Each PC gets **+1 stress** box. This costs three upgrades to unlock, not just one.
BITD.crew_upgrade_thief_rigging_descript: You get 2 free load worth of tool or gear items.
BITD.crew_upgrade_thief_rigging_long_des: For example, you could carry burglary gear and tinkering tools for zero load.
BITD.crew_upgrade_underground_maps_and_p: You have easy passage through the underground canals, tunnels, and basements of the city.
BITD.edge_fearsome_description: The cohort is terrifying in aspect and reputation.
BITD.edge_independent_description: The cohort can be trusted to make good decisions and act on their own initiative in the absence of direct orders.
BITD.edge_loyal_description: The cohort can’t be bribed or turned against you.
BITD.edge_tenacious_description: The cohort won’t be deterred from a task.
BITD.equipment_common_a_blade_or_two_des: Perhaps you carry a simple fighting knife. Or two curved swords. Or a rapier and stiletto. Or a heavy butcher’s cleaver.
BITD.equipment_common_a_large_weapon_des: A weapon meant for two hands. A battle-axe, greatsword, warhammer, or pole-arm. A hunting rifle. A blunderbuss. A bow or crossbow.
BITD.equipment_common_a_pistol_descripti: A heavy, single-shot, breechloading firearm. Devastating at 20 paces, slow to reload.
BITD.equipment_common_an_unusual_weapon_: A curiosity or tool turned into a weapon. A whip, a flail, a hatchet, a shovel, a length of chain, a razor-edged fan, steel-toed boots.
BITD.equipment_common_arcane_implements_: A vial of quicksilver. A pouch of black salt. A spirit anchor in the form of a small stone. A spirit bottle. A vial of electroplasm, designed to break and splatter on impact.
BITD.equipment_common_armor_description: A thick leather tunic plus reinforced gloves and boots.
BITD.equipment_common_burglary_gear_desc: A set of lockpicks. A small pry-bar. Vials of oil to silence squeaky hinges. A coil of wire and fishing hooks. A small pouch of fine sand.
BITD.equipment_common_climbing_gear_desc: A large coil of rope. A small coil of rope. Grappling hooks. A small pouch of chalk dust. A climbing harness with loops and metal rings. A set of iron pitons and a small mallet.
BITD.equipment_common_demolition_tools_d: A sledgehammer and iron spikes. Heavy drill. Crowbar.
BITD.equipment_common_documents_descript: A collection of slim volumes on a variety of topics, including a registry of the nobility, City Watch commanders, and other notable citizens. Blank pages, a vial of ink, a pen. A number of interesting maps.
BITD.equipment_common_heavy_description: The addition of chain mail, metal plates, a metal helm.
BITD.equipment_common_lantern_descriptio: A simple oil lantern, a fancy electroplasmic lamp, or other light source.
BITD.equipment_common_subterfuge_supplie: A theatrical makeup kit. A selection of blank documents, ready for the forger’s hand. Costume jewelry. A reversible cloak and distinctive hat. A forged badge of office.
BITD.equipment_common_tinkering_tools_de: An assortment for detailed mechanist work: jeweler’s loupe, tweezers, a small hammer, pliers, screwdriver, etc.
BITD.equipment_playbook_a_cane_sword_des: A slim sword and its sheath, disguised as a noble’s cane. The disguise will fool a cursory inspection.
BITD.equipment_playbook_a_trained_huntin: Your animal companion obeys your commands and anticipates your actions.
BITD.equipment_playbook_bandolier_of_alc: A strap worn across the body, fitted with specially-padded pouches to hold three alchemical agents or spark-craft bombs. When you employ an alchemical or bomb from a bandolier, choose one from the list at right (or one of your custom-made formulas). See page 226 for more on alchemicals and bombs.
During downtime, you automatically refill your bandoliers, so long as you have reasonable access to a supplier or workshop.
BITD.equipment_playbook_blowgun_and_dart: A small tube and darts that can be filled from alchemy flasks. Empty syringes.
Feel free to specify which plans you’re carrying when you choose this item.
BITD.equipment_playbook_blueprints_descr: A folio of useful architectural drawings and city plans
BITD.equipment_playbook_concealed_palm_p: A small firearm with a weak charge, easily concealed in a sleeve or waistcoat.
This pistol has extremely limited range; only a few feet. It’s very difficult to detect on your person, even if you’re searched.
BITD.equipment_playbook_dark_sight_goggl: An arcane device that allows the wearer to see in pitch darkness as if it were well-lit.
BITD.equipment_playbook_demonbane_charm_: An arcane trinket that demons prefer to avoid.
BITD.equipment_playbook_electroplasmic_a: A bandolier of electroplasmic ammo, especially potent against spirits, but less effective against physical targets.

The electrical charge is enough to stun a person, but does very little real harm. Several hits might incapacitate a human target. This ammunition is especially reactive in the ghost field—make a 4-clock called “Attention from the Spirit Wardens” and tick it for every operation in which this ammo was used.
BITD.equipment_playbook_fine_bottle_of_w: A rare distillation from your personal collection, potent both in its alcohol and its ability to impress.
BITD.equipment_playbook_fine_clothes_and: An outfit that appears to be of such fine make as to pass you off as a wealthy noble.
If you’re carrying this item as a second outfit to change into, it counts as **2 load**.
BITD.equipment_playbook_fine_cover_ident: Paperwork, planted stories and rumors, and false relationships sufficient to pass as a different person.
BITD.equipment_playbook_fine_disguise_ki: A theatrical make-up kit equipped with an impressive array of expert appliances to fool the eye.
The fine quality of this kit may increase the effect of your deceptive actions when you use it.
BITD.equipment_playbook_fine_hand_weapon: A finely crafted one-handed melee weapon of your choice.
Is this a well-crafted standard weapon, like a perfectly-balanced dagger, or something exotic, like an Iruvian dueling saber or a metal-banded war-club?
BITD.equipment_playbook_fine_heavy_weapo: A finely crafted two-handed melee weapon of your choice.

A warhammer, a greatsword, a military pike, a battleaxe, etc. A heavy weapon has more reach and hits harder than a standard weapon. This might give you potency when the power or reach of the weapon is a factor.
BITD.equipment_playbook_fine_lightning_h: A long, two-handed pole with a loop of heavy wire at the end, connected to an electroplasmic capacitor. Suitable for grappling a spirit and dragging it into a spirit bottle.
This custom-made hook collapses into a compact form, thus reducing its load to 1, even though it’s two-handed.
BITD.equipment_playbook_fine_loaded_dice: Gambling accouterments subtly altered to favor particular outcomes.
The fine quality of this kit may increase the effect of your deceptive actions when you use it.
BITD.equipment_playbook_fine_lockpicks_d: A finely crafted set of tools to disable and circumvent locks.
BITD.equipment_playbook_fine_long_rifle_: A finely crafted hunting rifle, deadly at long range, unwieldy in close quarters.
Long rifles are usually illegal for private citizens in Doskvol, but you have (real or forged) military paperwork for this one.
BITD.equipment_playbook_fine_pair_of_pis: A matched pair of handguns, made for greater accuracy, with double barrels that allow for two shots before reloading.
Were your pistols made by Kardera’s Daughters, Templeton & Slane, the Imperial Forge, or some other gunsmith? How do they stand out from the average handgun?
BITD.equipment_playbook_fine_shadow_cloa: A hooded cloak made of rare Iruvian shadow-silk that blends into the darkness around it.
This item improves your effect level when you sneak around.
BITD.equipment_playbook_fine_spirit_mask: An arcane item that allows the trained user to see supernatural energies in great detail. Also affords some measure of protection against ghostly possession.
Each spirit mask is unique. What does yours look like? What makes it strange and disturbing to see?
BITD.equipment_playbook_fine_tinkering_t: A finely crafted set of tools for detailed mechanist work. A jeweler’s loupe. Measuring devices.
BITD.equipment_playbook_fine_wrecking_to: A specialized set of tools for sabotage and destruction. A small, powerful drill. A mallet and steel spikes. A prybar. An electroplasmic battery, clamps, wire. Vials of acid. A spark-torch cutter and fuel tank.
BITD.equipment_playbook_gadget_descripti: You may create gadgets during downtime by **Tinkering** with tools and materials. See **Gadgets**, page 227.
BITD.equipment_playbook_gadget_long_desc: Track the load for each gadget you deploy during an operation.
BITD.equipment_playbook_ghost_key_descri: An arcane device that can open ghost doors.
BITD.equipment_playbook_ghost_key_long_d: There’s an echo of the entire city, across the ages, trapped in the ghost field. Sometimes a door to that place can be found.
BITD.equipment_playbook_light_climbing_g: A well-crafted set of climbing gear that is less bulky and heavy than a standard set.
BITD.equipment_playbook_manacles_and_cha: A set of heavy manacles and chain, suitable for restraining a prisoner.
A souvenir from a stay with the Bluecoats, perhaps?
BITD.equipment_playbook_rage_essence_via: single dose, which greatly enhances the user’s strength, resistance to pain, and irrational aggression for the span of several minutes.

The GM will modify your position and effect accordingly when you fight on rage essence. Also, you suffer two consequences: “Can’t Tell Friend From Foe” and “Can’t Stop Until They’re All Broken.” You may resist these as usual.
BITD.equipment_playbook_scary_weapon_or_: A scary-looking hand weapon or tool. This item grants increased effect when you intimidate, not increased harm in combat.
BITD.equipment_playbook_silence_potion_v: A vial of golden liquid that negates all sound within 10 paces of the drinker for a span of several moments.
BITD.equipment_playbook_spirit_bottles_d: An arcane device used to trap a spirit. A metal and crystalline cylinder, the size of a loaf of bread.
BITD.equipment_playbook_spyglass_descrip: A brass tube with lenses that allow long-distance vision. Collapsible. May attach to a rifle.
BITD.equipment_playbook_trance_powder_de: A dose of the popular drug, which induces an altered mental state.
BITD.equipment_playbook_trance_powder_lo: The victim of this powder is not fully unconscious, but rather retreats into a calm, suggestible mental state, similar to hypnotism.
BITD.equipment_playbook_vial_of_slumber_: A dose of slumber essence sufficient to put someone to sleep for an hour.
The victim’s sleep isn’t supernatural, but it is deep—they can be roused with some effort.
BITD.flaw_principled_description: The cohort has an ethic or values that it won’t betray.
BITD.flaw_savage_description: The cohort is excessively violent and cruel.
BITD.flaw_unreliable_description: The cohort isn’t always available, due to other obligations, stupefaction from their vices, etc.
BITD.flaw_wild_description: The cohort is drunken, debauched, and loud-mouthed.
BITD.heritage_akoros_description: A land of dark, petrified forests and rocky hills. The rich coastal cities get their wealth from leviathan hunting and from mining colonies deep inland. The Akorosi are sometimes called “Imperials” since the Imperium began there. They are generally fair-skinned and dark-haired.
BITD.heritage_iruvia_description: A land of black deserts, obsidian mountains, and raging volcanoes. Some say that positions of power are openly held by demons in Iruvia. The people are generally amber-skinned and dark-haired.
BITD.heritage_severos_description: A land of windswept plains, covered in dark scrub and thorny growths. Outside the Imperial cities on the coast, some native Serverosi still live in free tribes, scavenging the death-lands on their ghost-hunting horses. They are generally brown-skinned and dark-haired.
BITD.heritage_skovlan_description: A ragged land of cold mountains and rough tundra. Skovlan was the last holdout against Imperial control. They are generally pale-skinned and fair-haired or red-haired.
BITD.heritage_the_dagger_isles_descripti: A tropical archipelago covered in dense jungle growth; now turned dark and twisted from the strange magic of the cataclysm. Some say that the people there live without lightning barriers. How do they manage that? Native islanders are generally copper-skinned and dark-haired.
BITD.heritage_tycheros_description: A far off land, disconnected from the Empire. People say the Tycherosi (rudely called “Strangers”) have demon blood in their lineage.
BITD.vice_faith_description: You're dedicated to an unseen power, forgotten god, ancestor, etc.
BITD.vice_gambling_description: You crave games of chance, betting on sporting events, etc.
BITD.vice_luxury_description: Expensive and/or ostentatious displays of opulence.
BITD.vice_obligation_description: You're devoted to a family, a cause, a charity, etc.
BITD.vice_pleasure_description: Gratification from lovers, food, drink, drugs, art, theater, etc.
BITD.vice_stupor_description: You seek oblivion in the abuse of drugs, drink to excess, getting beaten to a pulp in the fighting pits, etc.
BITD.vice_weird_description: You experiment with strange essences, consort with rogue spirits, observe bizarre rituals or taboos, etc.
BITD.xp_trigger_assassins: Execute a successful accident, disappearance, murder, or ransom operation.
BITD.xp_trigger_bravos: Execute a successful battle, extortion, sabotage, or smash & grab operation
BITD.xp_trigger_cult: Advance the agenda of your deity or embody its precepts in action.
BITD.xp_trigger_cutter: You addressed a challenge with violence or coercion.
BITD.xp_trigger_hawkers: Acquire product supply, execute clandestine/covert sales, or secure new territory.
BITD.xp_trigger_hound: You addressed a challenge with tracking or violence.
BITD.xp_trigger_leech: You addressed a challenge with technical skill or mayhem.
BITD.xp_trigger_lurk: You addressed a challenge with stealth or evasion.
BITD.xp_trigger_shadows: Execute a successful espionage, sabotage, or theft operation.
BITD.xp_trigger_slide: You addressed a challenge with deception or influence.
BITD.xp_trigger_smugglers: Execute a successful smuggling or acquire new clients or contraband sources.
BITD.xp_trigger_spider: You addressed a challenge with calculation or conspiracy.
BITD.xp_trigger_vigilantes: Interfere with criminal scores, protect citizens, or antagonize the law.
BITD.xp_trigger_whisper: You addressed a challenge with knowledge or arcane power.
